articles.title: SK Hynix explores HBM chip collaboration with Kioxia
articles.summary: SK Hynix is exploring a collaboration with Kioxia Holdings Corp. to produce high bandwidth memory (HBM) chips, with a proposal for joint production at existing Kioxia-Western Digital plants in Japan. This move comes as SK Hynix reportedly opposes a merger between Kioxia and Western Digital, fearing it would create the world's largest NAND memory manufacturer. The collaboration would leverage SK Hynix's HBM expertise and Kioxia's facilities to meet soaring demand for AI applications while potentially influencing the Kioxia-Western Digital merger discussions.

articles.title: SoundHound AI: Sniffing Out A Bubble (NASDAQ:SOUN)
articles.summary: This article expresses skepticism about SoundHound AI's stock valuation, deeming it a potential bubble fueled by AI hype and Nvidia's involvement. While acknowledging the company's growth in voice solutions, the author questions its long-term competitive positioning due to rapidly advancing AI capabilities and believes the current valuation is unsustainable given future growth expectations.

articles.title: The AI Megatrend: 3 Global X ETFs to Capitalize on the Artificial Intelligence Frenzy
articles.summary: This article highlights three Global X Artificial Intelligence ETFs (BOTZ, AIQ, CLOU) that investors can consider to capitalize on the growing AI megatrend. It details the holdings, focus, and performance of each ETF, emphasizing Nvidia's significant role in some. The author also discusses the broader landscape of AI ETFs and the importance of understanding their underlying assets.

articles.title: The Rise of Humanoids, Explained
articles.summary: This article discusses the rapid advancements and growing market potential of humanoid robots, driven by technological convergence of robotics and AI, and decreasing hardware costs. It highlights how humanoids are poised for mainstream adoption in industrial and household settings, potentially creating a multi-trillion dollar market by 2035, and identifies investment opportunities across the supply chain. The piece also details the challenges and improvements needed for widespread adoption, comparing the trajectory of humanoids to that of early automobiles and collaborative robots.

articles.title: NANC ETF Tracking Democrat Stock Trades Beating S&P 500 on Tech Bets
articles.summary: The Unusual Whales Democratic ETF (NANC), which tracks stock trades by Democrats in Congress, has outperformed the S&P 500 since its launch in February 2023, returning 30% compared to the S&P 500's 24%. This outperformance is largely attributed to its significant holdings in mega-cap tech stocks like Microsoft, Amazon, Apple, and Nvidia. In contrast, a similar ETF tracking Republican trades (KRUZ) has only gained about 15% over the same period.

articles.title: ServiceNow, Hugging Face, and NVIDIA Release New Open-Access LLMs to Help Developers Tap Generative AI to Build Enterprise Applications
articles.summary: ServiceNow, Hugging Face, and NVIDIA have released StarCoder2, a new family of open-access large language models (LLMs) for code generation. These models, developed by the BigCode community, aim to help developers build enterprise applications using generative AI with improved performance, transparency, and cost-effectiveness. StarCoder2 offers three model sizes, including a 3 billion-parameter model by ServiceNow and a 15 billion-parameter model by NVIDIA, and is trained on 619 programming languages for various specialized tasks.

articles.title: Micron begins production of a 'better' HBM3E memory
articles.summary: Micron Technology has started volume production of HBM3E DRAM for AI datacenters, claiming its offering consumes 30 percent less power than competitors. Its 24Gbyte 8-high HBM3E components will be featured in Nvidia's H200 tensor core GPUs shipping in Q2 2024, potentially positioning Micron ahead of rival SK Hynix in HBM3E production. The company is also preparing a 12-high 36Gbyte HBM3E component for introduction in March 2024, with its stock opening almost 5 percent higher on the news.

articles.title: ServiceNow and NVIDIA Expand Partnership With Introduction of Telco-Specific GenAI Solutions to Elevate Service Experiences
articles.summary: ServiceNow and NVIDIA have expanded their partnership to introduce telco-specific generative AI solutions aimed at improving service experiences. The first solution, Now Assist for Telecommunications Service Management (TSM), built on the Now Platform and leveraging NVIDIA AI, is designed to boost agent productivity, speed resolution times, and enhance customer experiences for telecommunications service providers. This collaboration focuses on using GenAI for critical use cases like customer care and service assurance to drive business transformation in the telco industry.

articles.title: TWN CEF: No FOMO, Ride The 'AI 5' Tailwind With This Hated Fund (NYSE:TWN)
articles.summary: The Taiwan Fund Inc (TWN) is a closed-end fund focused on long-term capital growth through actively managed investments in stocks listed on the Taiwan Stock Exchange. With approximately $330 million in assets, the fund primarily invests in companies like Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSM), which has significantly contributed to its recent performance. The article suggests this fund, despite being "hated," offers a way to capitalize on the "AI 5" tailwind.

articles.title: How Nvidia grew to a trillion-dollar company fueling the AI revolution
articles.summary: Nvidia has grown into a nearly $3 trillion company by specializing in Graphics Processing Units (GPUs), which have become crucial for the artificial intelligence revolution. Initially used for gaming, GPUs' ability to perform concurrent calculations makes them ideal for AI, giving Nvidia a significant first-mover advantage and market dominance. The company's unique technology and supply chain have led to widespread adoption by major tech firms, with discussions emerging about potential shortages and the need for continued investment in chip manufacturing.

articles.title: SPY ETF Reaches Record High Amid Nvidia-Fueled AI Rally—Key Chart Pattern to Watch
articles.summary: The SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) reached a record high, mirroring the S&P 500's surge driven by mega-cap technology stocks, particularly after Nvidia's strong earnings report. Nvidia, along with other AI-related companies like Microsoft and Broadcom, contributed significantly to the rally, highlighting the outsized influence of Magnificent Seven stocks within the SPY's portfolio. Investors should watch the SPY's rising wedge pattern for potential breakouts or breakdowns, which could signal future price movements.

articles.title: AI Theme 'Skyrockets', ETFs 'Attracting a Gold Rush': Who Will Be the Next NVIDIA?
articles.summary: NVIDIA's recent exceptional earnings, with a 265% year-over-year Q4 revenue increase and 765% earnings per share surge, have driven its stock to new highs and significantly boosted its market value. This success has also fueled a "gold rush" into semiconductor and AI-related ETFs, with funds like the VanEck Vectors Semiconductor ETF and leveraged NVIDIA-focused ETFs experiencing substantial capital inflows and impressive gains. The article highlights that the AI dividend is far from over, with projections for significant growth in the semiconductor industry and AI-related applications globally.

articles.title: Lotus Tech completes merger with LCAA, to trade as LOT on Nasdaq
articles.summary: Lotus Technology Inc., a luxury electric vehicle manufacturer, has completed its merger with L Catterton Asia Acquisition Corp (LCAA). The combined entity, now named Lotus Technology Inc., will begin trading its American depositary shares on Nasdaq under the ticker symbol "LOT" on February 23, 2024. This U.S. listing is a significant step in Lotus Tech's global expansion strategy for sustainable luxury mobility.

articles.title: Dimensional ETFs and More: New on Syfe Custom Portfolio
articles.summary: Syfe Custom Portfolio is expanding its offerings with new equity ETFs from Dimensional Fund Advisors, focusing on value and quality tilts, alongside additional quality-focused and equally-weighted Nasdaq ETFs. The article details Dimensional's factor-based investing approach and highlights specific ETFs added to the platform, including options for accredited investors such as Bitcoin ETFs and a Nasdaq Equity Premium Income ETF. Syfe also explains how to utilize Custom Portfolios to complement existing investments by allowing tactical allocation based on asset class, risk, geography, and sector.

articles.title: DigitalOcean beats expectations under the helm of new CEO Paddy Srinivasan
articles.summary: DigitalOcean Holdings Inc. exceeded earnings and revenue expectations for the last quarter and provided optimistic guidance for the current quarter, leading to a stock surge. The company, under new CEO Paddy Srinivasan, is strategically focusing on AI solutions for small businesses, utilizing its Paperspace platform to offer Nvidia H100 GPUs, and demonstrating strong growth in its annual revenue run rate and average revenue per customer. Despite a slowdown in growth in the final quarter, analysts believe AI will be a key strategy for rekindling growth under the new leadership.

articles.title: Intel Foundry Collaborating With Cadence On SoC Designs Using Cutting-Edge 18A Process
articles.summary: Intel Foundry Services (IFS) has expanded its partnership with Cadence Design Systems through a multiyear strategic agreement. This collaboration aims to jointly develop customized IP and optimized design flows for Intel's 18A technology, featuring RibbonFET transistors and PowerVia delivery. The goal is to accelerate SoC project schedules for joint customers, optimizing performance for demanding AI, HPC, and premium mobile applications.

articles.title: NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for Fourth Quarter and Fiscal 2024
articles.summary: NVIDIA reported record-breaking financial results for the fourth quarter and fiscal year 2024, driven by surging demand for accelerated computing and generative AI. The company achieved record quarterly revenue of $22.1 billion and full-year revenue of $60.9 billion, with significant growth in its Data Center segment. NVIDIA also announced a quarterly cash dividend and provided an optimistic outlook for the first quarter of fiscal 2025.

articles.title: Dow's nearly 125-point rally led by gains for shares of NVIDIA Corp., Cisco
articles.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose by nearly 125 points, primarily driven by strong performances from NVIDIA Corp. and Cisco Systems Inc. NVIDIA's shares surged after an analyst upgrade, while Cisco remained relatively flat despite an analyst reiteration of an overweight rating. The overall market saw NVIDIA and Cisco among the top gainers, contrasting with losses from other Dow components.

articles.title: VONG ETF: A Great Way to Invest in Top Growth Stocks
articles.summary: The Vanguard Russell 1000 Growth ETF (VONG) offers a straightforward and effective way to invest in a diverse range of top growth stocks. With a strong track record of impressive returns, a low expense ratio of 0.08%, and a portfolio that includes leading mega-cap technology companies and other high-growth firms, VONG is considered a compelling option for investors seeking exposure to large-cap growth in the U.S. market. The ETF's holdings are highly rated, with many featuring Outperform-equivalent Smart Scores.

articles.title: Nvidia's Rally Casts Spotlight on 2 Leveraged ETFs
articles.summary: Nvidia's strong financial performance, including 265% year-over-year revenue growth, has propelled its stock, highlighting the potential for leveraged ETFs invested in the company. For bullish investors, the Direxion Daily NVDA Bull 1.5X Shares (NVDU) offers increased exposure, while the Direxion Daily NVDA Bear 1X Shares (NVDD) provides an option for short-term profit-taking or hedging. Additionally, the Direxion Daily Robotics, Artificial Intelligence & Automation Index Bull 2X ETF (UBOT) benefits from Nvidia's AI-driven growth as Nvidia comprises a significant portion of its holdings.

articles.title: What's Cathie Wood been selling?
articles.summary: Cathie Wood's Ark Investment Management has sold shares of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Corp. and Nvidia Corp., diversifying holdings amidst the AI frenzy. This marks Wood's first sale of TSMC stock in over two years and follows previous sales of Nvidia. The move comes as both TSMC and Nvidia have seen significant gains, with Wood's funds betting on growth potential in less-talked-about software companies like UiPath and Twilio, despite earlier predictions of AI's transformative impact.

articles.title: SPY First ETF to Reach $500B in Assets
articles.summary: The SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) made history by becoming the first ETF to reach $500 billion in assets under management. This milestone follows the S&P 500 surpassing the 5,000 mark, driven by strong performance from large technology companies. Despite significant outflows, the fund's liquidity and broad investor base are cited as key drivers of its growth.

articles.title: Magnificent Seven vs. the ‘Granolas’: How does Europe’s version stack up?
articles.summary: This article compares the U.S. "Magnificent Seven" stocks with Europe's "Granolas," highlighting their differences in market value, sector diversity, and profitability. While the Magnificent Seven are largely tech-driven and exceptionally profitable, the Granolas offer broader sector representation and solid returns, often trading at a discount despite their strong performance. The piece examines historical returns, valuation ratios, and individual stock assessments for both groups.

articles.title: Nvidia skyrocketed over the past 5 years, but 3 stocks performed even better—and none is Apple or Tesla
articles.summary: While Nvidia has achieved an impressive 1,904% return over the past five years, three mid-cap stocks have significantly outpaced it: e.l.f. Beauty (2,491%), Super Micro Computer (4,175%), and Celsius Holdings (over 5,300%). The article highlights that smaller companies (mid-caps) often show greater growth potential and less media coverage than large-cap stocks like Nvidia, suggesting diversification into these smaller companies can boost long-term returns. Investors are advised to use diversified funds (ETFs and mutual funds) to mitigate volatility and risk associated with individual small-cap stock picks.
